body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #17428 (p2p: Try to preserve outbound block-relay-only connections during restart by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Updated 00a3b45696fea7ad3a6c00b769ec6c2fc53c1b5c -> 756c9dcfa9e9b609ad7dd07c1e802c9f0a65c743 ([pr20076.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20076.01) -> [pr20076.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20076.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr20076.01..pr20076.02)):

- addressed @jonatack's comments, dropped unneeded grammar changes
@naumenkogs Mind looking into this doc update as it is about `ip_asn.map` file?

Everything looks good.

W.r.t asmap, maybe instead of (or in addition to) linking a wikipedia article we should link some asmap-related info? I couldn't find a good webpage to link, so maybe just add "Experimental feature: see [asmap-CLI](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/42065518d937e036cce6b0ad21890f8fc2c50cfc/doc/release-notes/release-notes-0.20.0.md#new-settings) and [asmap-utility](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18573)"

Updated 8d1ab6c7330d79e4535c8fe0adbbc0df22c1e794 -> 2dc79c4264d608ebe48c980f0ead54274ab3ee4f ([pr20076.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20076.03) -> [pr20076.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20076.04), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr20076.03..pr20076.04)).

@naumenkogs 
> W.r.t asmap, maybe instead of (or in addition to) linking a wikipedia article we should link some asmap-related info? I couldn't find a good webpage to link, so maybe just add "Experimental feature: see [asmap-CLI](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/42065518d937e036cce6b0ad21890f8fc2c50cfc/doc/release-notes/release-notes-0.20.0.md#new-settings) and [asmap-utility](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18573)"

Reworked. I don't think adding link to the feature description is the purpose of this file.

diff_hunk:
@@ -26,40 +26,42 @@ Linux    | `$HOME/.bitcoin/`
 macOS    | `$HOME/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/`
 Windows  | `%APPDATA%\Bitcoin\` <sup>[\[1\]](#note1)</sup>
 
-2. The non-default data directory path can be specified by `-datadir` option.
+2. The data directory path can be specified with `-datadir` option.

@@ -26,40 +26,42 @@ Linux    | `$HOME/.bitcoin/`
 macOS    | `$HOME/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/`
 Windows  | `%APPDATA%\Bitcoin\` <sup>[\[1\]](#note1)</sup>
 
-2. The non-default data directory path can be specified by `-datadir` option.
+2. The data directory path can be specified with `-datadir` option.
 
 3. All content of the data directory, except for `bitcoin.conf` file, is chain-specific. This means the actual data directory paths for non-mainnet cases differ:
 
-Chain option        | Data directory path
---------------------|--------------------
-no option (mainnet) | *path_to_datadir*`/`
-`-testnet`          | *path_to_datadir*`/testnet3/`
-`-regtest`          | *path_to_datadir*`/regtest/`
+Chain option                   | Data directory path
+-------------------------------|------------------------------
+`-chain=main` (by default)     | *path_to_datadir*`/`
+`-chain=signet` or `-signet`   | *path_to_datadir*`/signet/`
body: generally, the chain order in the codebase is main/test/signet/regtest

diff_hunk:
@@ -26,40 +26,42 @@ Linux    | `$HOME/.bitcoin/`
 macOS    | `$HOME/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/`
 Windows  | `%APPDATA%\Bitcoin\` <sup>[\[1\]](#note1)</sup>
 
-2. The non-default data directory path can be specified by `-datadir` option.
+2. The data directory path can be specified with `-datadir` option.
 
 3. All content of the data directory, except for `bitcoin.conf` file, is chain-specific. This means the actual data directory paths for non-mainnet cases differ:
 
-Chain option        | Data directory path
---------------------|--------------------
-no option (mainnet) | *path_to_datadir*`/`
-`-testnet`          | *path_to_datadir*`/testnet3/`
-`-regtest`          | *path_to_datadir*`/regtest/`
+Chain option                   | Data directory path
+-------------------------------|------------------------------
+`-chain=main` (by default)     | *path_to_datadir*`/`
+`-chain=signet` or `-signet`   | *path_to_datadir*`/signet/`
+`-chain=test` or `-testnet`    | *path_to_datadir*`/testnet3/`
+`-chain=regtest` or `-regtest` | *path_to_datadir*`/regtest/`
 
 ## Data directory layout
 
 Subdirectory       | File(s)               | Description
 -------------------|-----------------------|------------
-`blocks/`          |                       | Blocks directory; can be specified by `-blocksdir` option (except for `blocks/index/`)
+`blocks/`          |                       | Blocks directory. Path can be specified with `-blocksdir` option (except for `blocks/index/`)
body:
s/. Path/; path/ (to avoid full sentence structure and need for EOL full stop)

s/with/by/ or /with/with the/

+2. The data directory path can be specified with `-datadir` option.
 
 3. All content of the data directory, except for `bitcoin.conf` file, is chain-specific. This means the actual data directory paths for non-mainnet cases differ:
 
-Chain option        | Data directory path
---------------------|--------------------
-no option (mainnet) | *path_to_datadir*`/`
-`-testnet`          | *path_to_datadir*`/testnet3/`
-`-regtest`          | *path_to_datadir*`/regtest/`
+Chain option                   | Data directory path
+-------------------------------|------------------------------
+`-chain=main` (by default)     | *path_to_datadir*`/`
+`-chain=signet` or `-signet`   | *path_to_datadir*`/signet/`
+`-chain=test` or `-testnet`    | *path_to_datadir*`/testnet3/`
+`-chain=regtest` or `-regtest` | *path_to_datadir*`/regtest/`
 
 ## Data directory layout
 
 Subdirectory       | File(s)               | Description
 -------------------|-----------------------|------------
-`blocks/`          |                       | Blocks directory; can be specified by `-blocksdir` option (except for `blocks/index/`)
+`blocks/`          |                       | Blocks directory. Path can be specified with `-blocksdir` option (except for `blocks/index/`)
 `blocks/index/`    | LevelDB database      | Block index; `-blocksdir` option does not affect this path
 `blocks/`          | `blkNNNNN.dat`<sup>[\[2\]](#note2)</sup> | Actual Bitcoin blocks (in network format, dumped in raw on disk, 128 MiB per file)
 `blocks/`          | `revNNNNN.dat`<sup>[\[2\]](#note2)</sup> | Block undo data (custom format)
-`chainstate/`      | LevelDB database      | Blockchain state (a compact representation of all currently unspent transaction outputs and some metadata about the transactions they are from)
+`chainstate/`      | LevelDB database      | Blockchain state (a compact representation of all currently unspent transaction outputs (UTXO) and some metadata about the transactions they are from)

body:
Since this is a full sentence, I guess it should have s/by/by the/.

Maybe

"A custom data directory path can be specified by the `-datadir` option."

or

"A non-default data directory path can be specified by the `-datadir` option."

diff_hunk:
@@ -26,15 +26,16 @@ Linux    | `$HOME/.bitcoin/`
 macOS    | `$HOME/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/`

-2. The non-default data directory path can be specified by `-datadir` option.
+2. The data directory path can be specified by `-datadir` option.
